answerText: IR spectroscopy [or infrared spectroscopy][10] This functional group has an IR spectrum with a sharp peak around 1700 inverse centimeters. Grignard reagents attack this functional group to form alcohols.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 19 | 16 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The two dimensional form of this technique can be used to follow the breakage and formation of hydrogen bonds at very high speed. For 10 points each: [10] Name this type of spectroscopy which uses wavelengths longer than visible light in order to probe the vibrational modes of molecules
